title: W3C HTML Media Extensions Working Group-relevant MDN issues
description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C HTML Media Extensions Working Group

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SourceBuffer/appendBuffer

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

No response

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

Missing:

  • That sourcebuffer's have some platform specific size limit (usually enough for about 5 minutes of playback at a medium quality) meaning that it's usually not feasible to load all of a media up front into a sourcebuffer (unless it has a short playback time or is of low quality)

  • That sourcebuffers appendBuffer method can cause a QuotaExceededError to be thrown

What did you expect to see?

Something along the lines of:

Sourcebuffers are of a platform specific maximum size, they usually hold about a maximum of 5 minutes worth of playback at a medium quality. Limits for video sourcebuffers are usually larger than limits for audio sourcebuffers.

If you try to append to a sourcebuffer and it's already full it will cause a QuotaExceededError to be thrown.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

https://developer.chrome.com/blog/quotaexceedederror

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response
